en:
Join the hundreds of researchers from around
           the world who are part of the Open Specy community by
           analyzing, sharing, processing, and identifying
           their Raman and IR spectra. These services are free and open source thanks to our partners:
mi:
Hono atu ki nga rau o nga kairangahau mai i nga wa katoa
           te ao kei roto i te hapori Open Specy na
           te tātari, te tiri, te tukatuka, me te tautuhi
           ratou Raman me IR tūāwhiorangi. Ko enei ratonga he kore utu me te tuwhera puna whakawhetai ki o maatau hoa:

en:
In Brief: To use the tool upload a csv, asp, jdx, spc, or spa file to the upload file tab.
                                  If csv, one column should be named 'wavenumber' (in units of 1/cm) and another named 'intensity'.
                                  You can smooth your data using an SG filter, baseline correct your data using the polynomial order of iModPolyFit, and restrict the wavelength range for the match.
                                  The result will be compared to an internal Raman or FTIR spectra library. The strongest 1000 matches along with your
                                  uploaded or processed data will be presented in an interactive plot and table. For more details click the button below
                                  or watch the detailed instructional video.
mi:
He Poto: Hei whakamahi i te taputapu tukuake he csv, asp, jdx, spc, he konae kaukau ranei ki te ripa konae tukuake.
                                  Mēnā csv, me whakaingoatia tētahi tīwae 'tau ngaru' (i ngā waeine 1/cm) me te ingoa 'kaha' tetahi.
                                  Ka taea e koe te whakaene i o raraunga ma te whakamahi i te tātari SG, ka whakatikahia o raraunga ma te whakamahi i te raupapa polynomial o iModPolyFit, me te aukati i te awhe roangaru mo te whakataetae.
                                  Ka whakatauritea te hua ki tetahi whare pukapuka a Raman o roto, FTIR ranei. Ko nga whakataetae 1000 tino kaha me to
                                  Ko nga raraunga kua tukuake, kua tukatukahia ranei ka whakaatuhia ki roto i te papaa me te ripanga tauwhitiwhiti. Mo etahi atu taipitopito pawhiria te paatene kei raro nei
                                  mataki ranei i te ataata tohutohu taipitopito.

en:
Reference spectra was sourced from open access resources
           online, peer reviewed publications, and corporate donations. In the future
           spectra that is uploaded to the tool will be incorporated to the reference
           library to make it even better.
mi:
I ahu mai nga tohutoro tohutoro mai i nga rauemi uru tuwhera
           ipurangi, pukapuka arotakehia e te hoa, me nga takoha umanga. Ake ake nei
           Ko te hiranga ka tukuna ki te taputapu ka whakauruhia ki te tohutoro
           whare pukapuka kia pai ake.

en:
To share spectra upload a file to the upload file tab. If you selected Share a copy of your spectra will be sent to the Community
           Data Warehouse on Open Science Framework. To add additional metadata, 
           fill in the avaliable metadata fields and click -Share Data-. The 
           spectra file that you uploaded along with your responses will be copied 
           to the a -With Metadata- subfolder at the link below. All shared data holds 
           a Creative Commons Attribution License 4.0.
mi:
Ki te tiritiri spectra tukuake he konae ki te ripa konae tukuake. Mena i tohua e koe Tirihia he kape o to hiranga ka tukuna ki te Hapori
           Putaka Raraunga i runga i te Anga Putaiao Tuwhera. Hei taapiri metadata taapiri,
           whakakiia nga waahi metadata e waatea ana ka paato -Tiri Raraunga-. Ko te
           Ko te konae spectra i tuku ake me o whakautu ka kapea
           ki te kōpakiroto -With Metadata- kei te hono i raro nei. Katoa nga raraunga tiritahi ka mau
           he Raihana Whakaaetanga Creative Commons 4.0.

en:
All parameters in this tool are tested to validate that 
           the tool is functioning as best as possible and determine the best default 
           parameters to use. Our current validation proceedure includes correcting 
           duplicated entries in the reference libraries, checking for spectra in 
           metadata that isn't in the spectral library, and ensuring the the default 
           parameters provide over 80% accuracy in the first match.
mi:
Ko nga tawhā katoa o tenei taputapu ka whakamatauria hei whakamana i tera
           kei te mahi pai te taputapu me te whakatau i te taunoa pai rawa atu
           tawhā hei whakamahi. Kei roto i a maatau mahi whakamana o naianei he whakatikatika
           tārite tāurunga i roto i te whare pukapuka tohutoro, tirohia mo te spectra i roto
           metadata karekau i te whare pukapuka spectral, me te whakarite i te taunoa
           Ko nga tawhā ka nui ake i te 80% te tika i te tukinga tuatahi.

en: Updates, Feature Requests, and Bug Reports
mi: Nga Whakahoutanga, Nga Tono Whakaaturanga, me nga Purongo Bug

en: We keep track of all updates using version control on our code. Features can be requested and bug reported on GitHub.
mi: Ka aroturuki matou i nga whakahou katoa ma te whakamahi i te mana putanga i runga i to maatau waehere. Ka taea te tono mo nga ahuatanga me te whakaatu i te bug i runga i GitHub.
Kia mau ki nga korero hou!

en: Follow us on Twitter @OpenSpecy. E-mail wincowger@gmail.com to be added to the mailing list.
mi: A pee ia matou i runga i Twitter @OpenSpecy. Ī-mēra wincowger@gmail.com ki te tāpiri ki te rārangi mēra.

en: Free FTIR Software: siMPle microplastic IR spectral identification software
mi: Pūmanawa FTIR Koreutu: SiMPle microplastic IR spectral software identification

en: Free Spectroscopy Learning Academy from ThermoFisher
mi: Te Whare Wananga Ako Turangaranga Koreutu mai i ThermoFisher

en: Free Optical Microscopy Learning Resource from Florida State University
mi: Rauemi Ako Mataiti Mataiti Koreutu mai i te Whare Wananga o Florida State

en: Free desktop application for spectral analysis and links to reference databases.
mi: Ko te tono papamahi kore utu mo te tātari matakite me nga hononga ki nga papaunga korero.

en:
If you like, we share your uploaded spectra and settings with the spectroscopy community.
           By default, all data will be licensed under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International (CC BY-NC 4.0).
           Uploaded spectra will appear here: https://osf.io/rjg3c
mi:
Ki te pai koe, ka tohatohahia e matou to hiranga me to tautuhinga ki te hapori spectroscopy.
           Ma te taunoa, ka raihanahia nga raraunga katoa i raro i te Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International (CC BY-NC 4.0).
           Ka puta mai te tuwha kua tukuna ki konei: https://osf.io/rjg3c

en:
Upload Raman or FTIR spectrum files as a csv, jdx, spc, or spa. A csv file is preferred. If a csv, the file must contain one column labeled 'wavenumber' in units of (1/cm) and another column labeled 'intensity' in absorbance units.
            If jdx, spc, spa, or 0 the file should be a single absorbance spectrum with wavenumber in (1/cm). These files will not always work perfectly because they are tricky to read so double check them in another software.
            Hit the 'Test Data' button to download a sample Raman spectrum.
mi:
Tukua ake nga konae awhiowhio Raman, FTIR ranei hei csv, jdx, spc, kaukau ranei. He pai ake te konae csv. Mēnā he csv, me mau te kōnae kia kotahi te tīwae kua tapaina he 'tau ngaru' i roto i nga waeine o (1/cm) me tetahi atu pou kua tapaina he 'kaha' i roto i nga wae mimiti.
            Mena ko te jdx, spc, spa, 0 ranei te konae kia kotahi te hihinga toronga me te tau ngaru (1/cm). Ko enei konae kare e tino mahi i nga wa katoa na te mea he uaua ki te panui kia rua tirohia ki tetahi atu rorohiko.
            Patua te paatene 'Raraunga Whakamatau' hei tango i tetahi tauira awhiowhio Raman.

en:
If the uploaded spectrum is not in absorbance units, 
           use this input to specify the units to convert from.Open Specy can 
           adjust reflectance or transmittance spectra to Absorbance units using 
           this drop down in the upload file tab. All of the preceding tabs 
           assume that the data is in absorbance units so you should make the 
           correction before continuing if needed. The transmittance adjustment 
           uses the log10(1/T) calculation which does not correct for system 
           and particle characteristics. The reflectance adjustment uses the 
           Kubelka-Munk equation (1-R)2/(2*R). We assume that the reflectance 
           is formatted as a percent from 1-100 and first correct the intensity by dividing by 100
           so that it fits the form expected by the equation.
           If none is selected, Open Specy assumes that the uploaded data is 
           an absorbance spectrum.
mi:
Mēnā kāre te tūāwhiorangi tukuake i roto i ngā waeine mimiti,
           whakamahia tenei urunga ki te tautuhi i nga wae hei huri mai. Ka taea e Open Specy
           te whakatika i te whakaata, te whakawhiti ranei i te tirohanga ki nga waeine Absorbance ma te whakamahi
           tenei taka iho i roto i te ripa kōnae tukuake. Katoa o nga ripa o mua
           Me whakaaro kei roto nga raraunga i nga wae whakaurunga na me hanga e koe te
           whakatikatika i mua i te haere tonu mena ka hiahiatia. Te whakatikatika whakawhiti
           ka whakamahi i te tatauranga roko10(1/T) kaore i te tika mo te punaha
           me nga ahuatanga matūriki. Ko te whakatikatika whakaata e whakamahi ana i te
           Whārite Kubelka-Munk (1-R)2/(2*R). Ka whakaarohia e matou ko te whakaata
           ka whakahōputuhia hei ōrau mai i te 1-100 ka whakatika tuatahi i te kaha mā te wehe ki te 100
           kia rite ki te ahua e tumanakohia ana e te wharite.
           Mena karekau he mea i kowhiria, ka whakaaro a Open Specy ko nga raraunga kua tuku ake
           he tuāwhiorangi mimiti.

en: This is a sample spectrum that can be uploaded to the tool for testing it out and understanding how the csv files should be formatted.
mi: He tauira awhiowhio tenei ka taea te tukuake ki te taputapu hei whakamatautau me te maarama me pehea te whakahōputu i nga konae csv.

en:
We share any uploaded spectra and metadata with the spectroscopy community if you fill out the metadata here and select share.
           Uploaded spectra and metadata will appear here: https://osf.io/rjg3c
mi:
Ka tiritirihia e matou nga momo momotuhinga me nga metadata kua tukuna ki te hapori spectroscopy mena ka whakakiia e koe nga metadata ki konei ka kowhiria te tiri.
           Ka puta mai te hiranga me te metadata i konei: https://osf.io/rjg3c

en: Upload some data to get started...
Smooth, Baseline Correct, and Download Processed Spectra
mi: Maeneene, Raina-a-mua e tika ana, me te Tikiake Spectra Tukatuka

en: Some users may wish to save a copy of their processed spectrum. This button downloads the processed spectrum as a csv file.
mi: Ko etahi o nga kaiwhakamahi kei te pirangi ki te tiaki i tetahi kape o ta raatau awhiowhio kua tukatukahia. Ka tangohia e tenei paatene te awhiowhio kua tukatukahia hei konae csv.

en: This smoother can enhance the signal to noise ratio of the data and uses a Savitzky-Golay filter with 12 running data points and the polynomial specified.
mi: Ka taea e tenei maeneene te whakarei ake i te tohu ki te haruru ōwehenga o nga raraunga me te whakamahi i te tātari Savitzky-Golay me nga tohu raraunga rere 12 me te polynomial kua tohua.

en: This baseline correction routine has two options for baseline correction, 1) the polynomial imodpolyfit procedure to itteratively find the baseline of the spectrum using a polynomial fit to the entire region of the spectra. 2) manual lines can be drawn using the line tool on the plot and the correct button will use the lines to subtract the baseline.
mi: E rua nga waahanga o tenei mahinga whakatikatika turanga, 1) te tikanga polynomial imodpolyfit ki te kimi i te rarangi turanga o te hihinga ma te whakamahi i te waahanga polynomial ki te rohe katoa o te hihinga. 2) ka taea te tuhi i nga raina a-ringa ma te whakamahi i te taputapu raina i runga i te papa, ka whakamahia e te paatene tika nga rarangi hei tango i te rarangi turanga.

en: Restricting the spectral range can remove regions of spectrum where no peaks exist and improve matching
mi: Ma te whakawhäiti i te awhe hihinga ka taea te tango i nga rohe o te hihinga karekau he tihi me te whakapai ake i te tauritenga

en: Identify Spectrum Using the Reference Library
mi: Tautuhia te Awhiowhio Ma te whakamahi i te Puna Tohutoro

en: This selection will determine whether the FTIR or Raman matching library is used. Choose the spectrum type that was uploaded.
mi: Ma tenei kowhiringa ka whakatau mena kei te whakamahia te whare pukapuka riterite FTIR, Raman ranei. Kōwhiria te momo tūāwhiorangi i tukuake.
Awhina ki te Tātarihia te tūāwhiorangi

en: This selection will determine whether the uploaded (not processed) spectrum or the spectrum processed using the processing tab is used in the spectrum match.
mi: Ma tenei kowhiringa ka whakatau mena ka whakamahia te awhiowhio tukuake (kaore i te tukatukahia), ko te awhiowhio ranei i tukatukahia ma te ripa tukatuka ka whakamahia i roto i te whakataetae awhiorangi.

en: This selection will determine whether the library you are matching to consists of the full spectrum or only spectrum peaks.
mi: Ma tenei kowhiringa ka whakatau mena kei te whare pukapuka e tauritehia ana e koe te tuāwhiorangi katoa, ko nga tihi awhiowhio anake ranei.

en: Help us reach our goal of revolutionizing spectroscopy.
mi: Awhina mai ki te whakatutuki i ta maatau whainga ki te huri i te hiranga.
Hokona Mai i te Toa Swag

en: A paid team that is pushing Open Specy closer to the ultimate goal of 100% accurate spectral identification and deep spectral diagnostics with a single click
mi: He roopu utu e turaki ana i a Open Specy kia tata atu ki te whainga o te 100% tika te tautuhi matakite me nga tātaritanga matakite hohonu me te paato kotahi

en: A single paid staff person working to update and build the community and the tool
mi: He kaimahi kotahi te utu e mahi ana ki te whakahou me te hanga i te hapori me te taputapu

en: Maintenance costs and minor ad-hoc updates and bug fixes
mi: Ko nga utu tiaki me nga whakahoutanga iti me nga whakatikatika iro

en: Keeping the app online and essential maintenance
mi: Te pupuri i te taupānga i runga ipurangi me te tino tiaki
Te rokiroki mo te wa roa anake

en: Thank you for sharing your data!
mi: Mauruuru koe mo te tohatoha i o raraunga!

en: Your data will soon be available at https://osf.io/stmv4/
mi: Ka waatea o raraunga i https://osf.io/stmv4/
Ko te momo raraunga kaore i te tautokona!

en:
Uploaded data type is not currently supported; please
                      check tooltips and 'About' tab for details.
mi:
Ko te momo raraunga kua tuku ake kaore i te tautokohia i tenei wa; tēnā koa
                      tirohia nga aki taputapu me te ripa 'Mo' mo nga taipitopito.
Tiri Awhiowhio ki te Whare Pukapuka Hapori

en:
If you uploaded a text/csv file, make sure that the 
           columns are numeric and named 'wavenumber' and 
           'intensity'.
mi:
Mena kua tukuna e koe he konae tuhinga/csv, kia mohio kei te
           he tau nga pou ka whakaingoatia ko 'tau ngaru' me
           'kaha'.
